main event: Five glowing objects were observed in the sky over South Charleston, Ohio on March 26, 1968.
interesting points: The objects were observed for 4-5 minutes.
The objects appeared to be solid, glowing, and silver-like in color.
The objects were seen to stand still at times and suddenly speed up and rush away.
No sound was reported from the objects.
The witness provided a sketch showing the objects in a formation, with an arrow indicating the direction they were traveling.
sighted object: five glowing, silver-like objects in the sky
